data.title: The Power of Talk: Who Gets Heard and Why
data.meta_description: We all know what confidence, competence, and authority sound like. Or do we?
data.text:
DT

Deborah Tannen is a Distinguished University Professor in the Linguistics Department at Georgetown University in Washington, D.C. She is the author of 15 books, including You Just Don’t Understand: Women and Men in Conversation (William Morrow, 1990), which introduced to the general public the idea of female and male styles of communication.
